case_vignette: A 64-year-old woman comes to the physician because of several episodes of dizziness during the last month. The episodes last between 30–40 seconds and during the episodes she feels as though she is spinning. Episodes usually occur immediately after lying down or suddenly sitting up from a reclined position. They also sometimes happen when she suddenly turns her head to look at something. She has no nausea. Last month, she had an upper respiratory tract infection that resolved spontaneously. She has hypertension treated with hydrochlorothiazide. Otoscopic examination shows no abnormalities. There is no lateralization when a vibrating 512 Hz tuning fork is placed in the middle of the forehead.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Neurology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been having several episodes of dizziness over the past month where it feels like I'm spinning.
Can you tell me your age and sex?
I am a 64-year-old woman.
Do you have a history of any ear infections or ear-related problems?
I had an upper respiratory tract infection last month but it got better on its own.
Do you take any medications or have any medical conditions?
I have hypertension and I take hydrochlorothiazide for it.
Do you have a history of migraines or do you experience headaches along with the dizziness?
I don't have a history of migraines and I don't experience headaches with the dizziness.
Is there a family history of any neurological disorders or conditions such as Meniere's disease?
I'm sorry, but I cannot provide any information on family history as it was not mentioned in my case details.
**Final Diagnosis:** Benign Paroxysmal Positional Vertigo
